item.title: Extensive littering in the alleyway leading up to Sainsburys Beckenham and the betting shop, 9th January
item.description:
Constant litter which looks like it has been there for weeks outside the Paddy Power betting shop and front of Sainsburys, and around the bushes in the alleyway - it looks an eyesore and not nice for shoppers. There is a homeless man who frequents that corner who maybe leaving his litter there. But is should be Beckenham responsibility to keep this area clean. The homeless man constantly sits there and is getting slightly annoying. Can something be done to deter this. What has happened to Beckenham's street cleaners, do we have one to replace the gentleman that recently passed as Beckenham is starting to look like a dumping tip. Someone must be responsible for this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Carleton Road, Holloway, Greater London

item.title: Graffiti Daneville Road, 9th January
item.description:
Graffiti on 1) side black acoustic wall Morrisons (car park side) NOSE and nearby tree MALDOG; 2) Red Danger door in Morrisons car park MALDOG and 3) far wall of car park by the houses MASKS and wording UBIK GECM for removal please! Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Daneville Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Broken glass and firework remnants on Ashlar Place, 9th January
item.description:
Someone let off fireworks on New Year's Eve in this shared green space, which has burned the grass. More concerning is the large amount of glass that has been left across the pavement and grass - many people have small kids and pets around the road and I'm concerned someone will get hurt. They also have left a lot of rubbish from the fireworks going off.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ashlar Place, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defoe Close: Fly tipping tree barks, 9th January
item.description:
Defoe Close does not get cleaned. There’s always always fly tipping. Council don’t take care of this road. Parking spaces are full or rubbish and weed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40-48, Vaughan Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking Sign stolen and bycicle stolen, 9th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Building rubble and garden waste dumped, 9th January
item.description:
New tenants at 2 Resolution Walk have demolished a garden wall and dumped it on the communal grass area at the rear of 1 to 4 Resolution Walk and 9 to 12 Venus Road together with their garden waste. I recognise it as I used to help the previous tenants with their gardens. It is an eyesore and a hazard to wildlife and when I walk my dog.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Venus Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet
